sect2.title: Installation of MesaLib
sect2.para: You will need to adjust the commands below to reflect the installation prefix of the X Window System. First, correct several hard coded directories in the source files with the following commands:

screen.userinput: find . -type f -exec sed -i "s@/usr/X11R6@$XORG_PREFIX@g" {} \; && sed -i 's@lib/modules@lib/X11/modules@' src/glx/x11/dri_glx.c && sed -i 's@lib/modules@lib/X11/modules@' src/mesa/drivers/dri/Makefile.template

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: find...sed -i "s@/usr/X11R6@$XORG_PREFIX@"...: This command corrects several hard coded references to the X11R6 default installation path.
sed -i 's@lib/modules@lib/X11/modules@' src/glx/x11/dri_glx.c: This command corrects a hard coded reference to the module directory.
bin/installmesa: Mesa uses a custom installation script as opposed to the normal install make target.
install -v -m755 lib/*dri* $XORG_PREFIX/lib/X11/modules/dri: installs the DRI modules.
sed -i 's@-l$(GLUT_LIB)@@g' configs/default: disables linking against GLUT libraries for the demo programs.
make PROGS='glxinfo glxgears': build only the glxinfo and glxgears programs.
install -v -m755 glxinfo glxgears $XORG_PREFIX/bin: Installs only the glxinfo and glxgears programs.
